info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 9:39AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW CONTINUES, BUT TEMPERATURES RISING... A cold front continues to pass eastward through the morning with precipitation falling along the leading edge. Snow accumulation overnight into this morning ranged from a trace near river level to 6 inches at elevations above 500 feet. Temperatures continue to hover around 30 to 35 degrees. As the cold front exits the area in the afternoon, temperatures will rise above freezing and precipitation will ease. Additional light snow accumulation is probable, with an 80% chance of seeing 1 inch or more through the early afternoon; there is a 20-40% chance of seeing 2 inches or more and that is reserved to elevations above 1000 feet. Snow will taper in the late afternoon. Continue to drive with care, and call 5-1-1 to obtain information regarding road conditions in your area.
